title: Google Maps Scraper
description: Provide either a list of search keywords or search/place URLs.

startUrls.title: Start URLs
startUrls.description: List of URLs to be crawled. They can be search URLs or place URLs. The only valid format for URLs contains either /maps/search or /maps/place

searchStringsArray.title: Search Terms
searchStringsArray.description: Array of strings to be searched. It is also possible to fill in Google Place IDs in the format place_id:ChIJp4JiUCNP0xQR1JaSjpW_Hms. Setting geolocation input fields is more accurate than including location in the search string.

maxCrawledPlaces.title: Max crawled places
maxCrawledPlaces.description: Maximum number of places you scrape per whole run. If you want to scrape all available, set this to `9999999`.

maxCrawledPlacesPerSearch.title: Max crawled places per search
maxCrawledPlacesPerSearch.description: Maximum number of places you scrape per search term. If you want to scrape all available, set this to `9999999`.

language.title: Language
language.description: Force showing results in this language.

maxReviews.title: Max reviews (slow)
maxReviews.description: Max number of reviews per place to scrape. If you fill in 0 or nothing, no reviews will be scraped. For all reviews, just put 99999
maxReviews.sectionDescription: You can set what extra information you would like extracted. For maximum efficiency, the default setup doesn't include reviews or images. If you need these, just increase the maximum count for them.

maxImages.title: Max Images (Slow for more than 1)
maxImages.description: Max number of images per place to scrape. If you fill in 0 or nothing, no images will be scraped. For all images, just put 99999

includeHistogram.title: Include popular times
includeHistogram.description: If checked, the crawler scrapes popular times for all places. You can speed up crawling if you disable this.

includeOpeningHours.title: Include opening hours
includeOpeningHours.description: If checked, the crawler scrapes opening hours for all places. You can speed up crawling if you disable this.

includePeopleAlsoSearch.title: Include people also search
includePeopleAlsoSearch.description: If checked, the crawler scrapes "people also search" for all places. You can speed up crawling if you disable this.

additionalInfo.title: Additional Place Info
additionalInfo.description: Extract additional information about each place, e.g. Service Options, Highlights, Offerings, etc. You can speed up crawling if you disable this.

reviewsSort.title: Sort reviews by
reviewsSort.description: Define how reviews should be sorted.

reviewsTranslation.title: Reviews translation
reviewsTranslation.description: Google automatically adds translated text to the original. You can adjust this behavior here.

exportPlaceUrls.title: Export place URLs only (skips place details)
exportPlaceUrls.description: Scraper will return only place URLs without crawling their details.

country.title: Country
country.description: Set the country where the search should be performed, e.g. 'USA'. For more accurate search, set state, city or lat + lng.
country.sectionDescription: Here you can set where places should be searched. Either use country (and optionally state, city or postal code) or latitude and longitude for more accuracy. Using lat/long + zoom is generally much faster because the scraper doesn't traverse the whole country/state/city.

state.title: State
state.description: Set a state where the search should be performed, e.g. 'Massachusetts', 'England', 'Berlin', etc. For a more accurate search, set city or lat + lng.

county.title: County
county.description: Set the county where the search should be performed, e.g. 'washington'. For more accurate search, set state, city or lat + lng.

city.title: City
city.description: Set the city where the search should be performed, e.g. 'Pittsfield'. For a more accurate search, set lat and lng.

postalCode.title: Postal code
postalCode.description: Set the postal code where the search should be performed, e.g. 10001. Select a country as well to ensure the correct postal code is used. For a more accurate search, set lat and lng.

lat.title: Viewport point latitude
lat.description: Use in combination with longitude and zoom to set the viewport to search on. Has preference over country/state/city/postal.

lng.title: Viewport point longitude
lng.description: Use in combination with latitude and zoom to set the viewport to search on. Has preference over country/state/city/postal.

zoom.title: Viewport zoom level
zoom.description: Defines how detailed the scrape will be. A higher zoom level ensures that fewer known places are scraped, but will take more time to complete (with country/state/city) or extract smaller area (with lat + lng). Zoom 21 is a single street while zoom 1 is the whole planet. We recommend zoom 12-15 for most cases. You can test zoom by changing the number before 'z' in the URL: https://www.google.com/maps/@50.0860729,14.4135326,17z

maxAutomaticZoomOut.title: Max automatic zoom out
maxAutomaticZoomOut.description: Parameter to stop searching once Google zooms out too far. It counts how far it zoomed out compared to the first page. Keep in mind that `zoom: 1` is the whole world and `zoom: 21` is a tiny street. So usually you want `maxAutomaticZoomOut` to be between `0` and `5`. Also, keep in mind that Google zooms a bit differently in each run.

polygon.title: Manual polygon
polygon.description: Manual polygon to define exact search area if other geolocation parameters don't work well. See README for details.

proxyConfig.title: Proxy configuration
proxyConfig.description: You need to use Apify proxy or custom proxies. Automatic proxy works very well for Google Maps.
proxyConfig.sectionDescription: How the browsers will behave during the scraping process.

maxConcurrency.title: Max concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Maximum number of pages that will be processed in parallel. This is usually limited by the memory assigned to the run.

maxPageRetries.title: Max page retries
maxPageRetries.description: Maximum number of retries when page scraping fails. Set to 0 if you are getting repeated errors where retrying does not help (and report to support@apify.com or create new issue)

pageLoadTimeoutSec.title: Page load timeout seconds
pageLoadTimeoutSec.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for the page to load.

maxPagesPerBrowser.title: Max opened pages per browser
maxPagesPerBrowser.description: How many pages can be opened at once for each browser. Having more pages in one browser is faster but can lead to increased blocking.

useChrome.title: Use Chrome
useChrome.description: Uses full Chrome browser instead of Chromium. Be careful, it is not stable on some versions! Don't turn this on unless you know what you are doing.

debug.title: Debug log
debug.description: Debug messages will be included in the log.
debug.sectionDescription: Few additional settings that might be useful.

useStealth.title: Use stealth
useStealth.description: Enable stealth if you're not using Chrome. Use only if you know what you are doing.

scrapeReviewerName.title: Reviewer name
scrapeReviewerName.sectionDescription: All of these fields contain personal data. Personal data is protected by the GDPR in the European Union and by other regulations around the world. You should not scrape personal data unless you have a legitimate reason to do so. If you're unsure whether your reason is legitimate, consult your lawyers.
